Description: Part of a pottery vessel-cover affixed to object reg.no 1887,0101.1268 to form a single artefact with an open base and sides which converge to meet at a domed top, to which a circular handle is attached. Repaired from fragments with a number of pieces are missing from the sides. Made from a compact micaceous green marl clay. The interior and exterior were covered by a smooth slip, the colour of which varies from pale green to cream. This was probably burnished originally, as traces of spiral-pattern burnishing on the handle suggest.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 65 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 13 : "The curious form 13 seems to be a cover for placing over food to keep flies and dust away; if to be placed on a jar it would probably have some sign of fitting, and not be so deep". The Findspot number 19 A is written in pencil on the interior. Attached to 1887,0101.1268
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiv, 13)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.95, p.111, p.198, pl.40, p.220, pl.62)
